hackathon-description-text: Hackathons are events where people get together, dream up crazy ideas and transform them into reality using code. Come on Saturday, form a team, use your creativity to build a project, pitch it to a judge and compete for prizes. Along the way there'll be mentors there to help you and workshops for you to learn new things.
hackathon-requirements: Make your project, submit your hack to Devpost and demo your project to a judge to show off what you built. You

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $500 Indico Credits + MLH First Place Medals + Muse Headband + Google Waterloo HQ Tour + RBC Futuremaker Conference Tickets
$250 Indico Credits + MLH Second Place Medals + RBC Futuremaker Conference Tickets
$100 Indico Credits + MLH Third Place Medals + Github T-Shirt Coupons
A year of Wolfram|One Personal Edition plus a one-year subscription to Wolfram|Alpha Pro (Market Value of $375)
1 year of free personal subscription for any single JetBrains tool or IDE
$200 Amazon Gift Card for Team (Divided Evenly Amongst Members)

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Raspberry Pi and PiHut Essential Kit

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=175 Longwood Rd S, Hamilton, ON L8P 0A1, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Is it just some lipstick on an API, or were there real technical challenges to surmount? This is the most important criterion that your hack will be judged upon for the general prizes.
Is the hack more than just another generic social/mobile/local app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does everything appear to work? Is it well designed?
Is the hack practical? Is it something people would actually use? Does it fulfill a real need people have?

hackathon-location-address: 175 Longwood Rd S, Hamilton, ON L8P 0A1, Canada
hackathon-description-header: 24 Hours of Creativity, Swag, Free Food and Coding
